user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CloseAllFiles:
```c
int32 OS_CloseAllFiles(void)
{
    int32            return_code;
    int32            close_code;
    OS_object_iter_t iter;

    return_code = OS_SUCCESS;

    OS_ObjectIdIterateActive(LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, &iter);

    while (OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(&iter))
    {
        /* call OS_close() on the entry referred to by the iterator */
        close_code = OS_ObjectIdIteratorProcessEntry(&iter, OS_FileIteratorClose);
        if (close_code != OS_SUCCESS)
        {
            return_code = close_code;
        }
    }

    OS_ObjectIdIteratorDestroy(&iter);

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_CloseAllFiles:
bool OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(OS_object_iter_t *iter)
{
    OS_common_record_t *record;
    bool                got_next;

    got_next           = false;
    iter->token.obj_id = OS_OBJECT_ID_UNDEFINED;

    do
    {
        ++iter->token.obj_idx;
        if (iter->token.obj_idx >= iter->limit)
        {
            break;
        }

        record = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(iter->base, iter->token);
        if (iter->match == NULL || iter->match(iter->arg, &iter->token, record))
        {
            iter->token.obj_id = record->active_id;
            got_next           = true;
        }
    } while (!got_next);

    return got_next;
}
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdIterateActive(osal_objtype_t objtype, OS_object_iter_t *iter)
{
    return OS_ObjectIdIteratorInit(OS_ObjectFilterActive, NULL, objtype, iter);
}
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdIteratorInit(OS_ObjectMatchFunc_t matchfunc, void *matcharg, osal_objtype_t objtype,
                              OS_object_iter_t *iter)
{
    iter->match = matchfunc;
    iter->arg   = matcharg;
    iter->limit = OS_GetMaxForObjectType(objtype);
    iter->base  = &OS_common_table[OS_GetBaseForObjectType(objtype)];

    return OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, objtype, &iter->token);
}
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdIteratorProcessEntry(OS_object_iter_t *iter, int32 (*func)(osal_id_t, void *))
{
    int32 status;

    /*
     * This needs to temporarily unlock the global,
     * call the handler function, then re-lock.
     */
    OS_Unlock_Global(&iter->token);
    status = func(OS_ObjectIdFromToken(&iter->token), iter->arg);
    OS_Lock_Global(&iter->token);

    return status;
}
...
int32 OS_FileIteratorClose(osal_id_t filedes, void *arg)
{
    return OS_close(filedes);
}
...
void OS_ObjectIdIteratorDestroy(OS_object_iter_t *iter)
{
    OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel(&iter->token);
}
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: All other fragments in the provided code are simple initializations, single-return wrappers, trivial forwarders, or macro definitions and do not contain syntactically unreachable code by inspection. Specifically, the following were examined and judged not to require investigation for unreachable-code concerns: OS_ObjectIdIterateActive (single-line forwarder), OS_ObjectIdIteratorInit (initializes iterator fields and returns the result of a transaction-init call), OS_FileIteratorClose (single return wrapper around OS_close), OS_ObjectIdIteratorDestroy (single call to cancel transaction), the function prologue/variable declarations and final return in OS_CloseAllFiles, and the OS_SUCCESS macro. These constructs are straightforward and do not contain branches or statements that are, on their face, impossible to reach; therefore they are omitted from the suspicious list.
